channel.title: Bo Biafra on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Bo Biafra on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Unrest in the streets of Columbus and East Lansing after Michigan State beats Ohio State to win Big 10 football
item.description: Both Columbus, Ohio and East Lansing, Michigan are reporting unrest in the streets after the football victory by the Spartans over the Buckeyes. To listen in: Columbus Ohio Police Dispatch Ingham County Michigan Public Safety I'm looking for news stories from both areas. Twitter is moving fastest; it's hard to tell stories straight from the scanner. East Lansing From East Lansing, a series of couch fires, reported on by the State News and the Detroit News.

item.title: Bo Biafra: "the invisible paw of the International Wolverine Conspiracy has taken down Tressel"
item.description: The Columbus Dispatch broke the news this morning that Jim Tressel has resigned as head football coach at Ohio State University. A Sports Illustrated cover story details troubles with Tressel's leadership of the program, culminating in an NCAA investigation. For balanced reporting from Columbus about the football program I always turn to Bo Biafra, front man for the Columbus based punk band the Dead Schembechlers. Biafra knows the story with the Wolverines; it's best to have a "holy rivalry" with Michigan, and thus every problem in Columbus with the program gets blamed on the "New Wolverine Order", the "International Wolverine Conspiracy", or the "Mainstream Michigan Media".
